channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Battery giant Northvolt to lay off staff in huge cost-cutting drive amid EV market slowdown
item.description: Swedish battery maker Northvolt announced Monday that it plans to cut jobs and close down some facilities in Europe and the U.S.

item.title: Jumbo 50 basis points Fed rate cut should not raise alarm, analyst says
item.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve can afford to make a jumbo 50 basis points rate cut next week without spooking markets, an analyst suggested Monday.

item.title: Draghi urges radical European Union reform requiring extra 800 billion euros a year
item.description: The report lays out major challenges that the EU must address through a new industrial strategy, which would include reducing enegy prices.

item.title: The EU is a 'monster,' Dutch nationalist leader says, and it mustn't have more power
item.description: Dutch populist leader Geert Wilders insisted to CNBC that Europe needs less integration, not more.

item.title: A Porsche-backed startup is building a massive battery recycling plant to boost Europe's EV industry
item.description: Cylib, a startup backed by luxury sports car firm Porsche and appliances maker Bosch, is building a massive battery recycling facility in Germany.

item.title: Skype founder's VC firm raises $1.24 billion to back European tech startups
item.description: Atomico, which was founded by Skype co-founder Niklas Zennström, raised two new funds worth $1.24 billion to back European technology firms.

item.title: China's property market has 'not found a bottom' yet, Standard Chartered CEO Bill Winters says
item.description: Winters described the investing environment in China as "difficult," explaining consumer confidence and international investor confidence was relatively low.

item.title: This 29-year-old millionaire doesn’t own a home — here’s how he spends and invests his money instead
item.description: Timothy Armoo is not what you might expect from a multi-millionaire.

item.title: Huawei's trifold phone gets 2.7 million pre-orders ahead of Apple's iPhone 16 launch
item.description: Huawei has received more than 2.7 million pre-orders for its new, trifold smartphone, according to its website Monday.

item.title: Hang Seng leads losses in Asia; China consumer inflation comes in weaker than forecast
item.description: Traders in Asia assessed Japan's revised GDP figure for the second quarter and China's consumer price index report.

item.title: China's CPI climbs by a less-than-expected 0.6% as transport and home goods prices fall
item.description: China on Monday reported its consumer price index rose by 0.6% year on year in August, missing expectations.

item.title: Yellen says U.S. economy remains solid, on path to 'soft landing' with no meaningful layoffs
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said in August that the U.S. economy might be ready for an interest rate cut.

item.title: Carry trade unwind could replicate August mayhem, suggests currency strategist, as yen strengthens
item.description: Unwinding of the yen carry trade is expected to continue in September, presenting risk of another large sell-off, according to BK's Kathy Lien.

item.title: K-pop is more popular than ever, but that isn't helping agency stock prices
item.description: K-pop is seeing increasing popularity, with records being shattered on streaming services and concert crowds, but this is not reflected in the sector's share prices

item.title: 'Economic refugees' flee from New Zealand as cost-of-living crisis deepens
item.description: The economy is going to "get worse before it gets better," said Shamubeel Eaqub, principal economist at the New Zealand Institute of Economic Research.

item.title: Honor looks to get ahead of Apple in China with its own AI assistant
item.description: The upgraded AI agent from Honor will look to compete with the likes of Samsung's Bixby and Apple's Siri.

item.title: Many 'doubted the vision': Saudi investment minister touts 'green shoring' on path to diversification
item.description: Saudi Minister of Investment Khalid al-Falih pushed back on skepticism of Riyadh's economic diversification.

item.title: The bitcoin ATM has emerged as one of cryptocurrency's biggest threats
item.description: Bitcoin ATMs are a rapidly growing presence in the U.S. and, some experts say, a rapidly growing crime market.

item.title: Europe's economy survived 'terrible prophecies' but must now tackle trade with China: EU's Gentiloni
item.description: After surviving the "terrible prophecies," Europe's economy must face the challenges of the war in Ukraine and trade ties with China, EU's Paolo Gentiloni says.

item.title: Dell and Palantir to join S&P 500; shares of both jump
item.description: In the quarterly rebalancing of the S&P 500, tech companies Dell and Palantir were added to the benchmark index.

item.title: CIA director saw ‘genuine risk’ of Russia using tactical nuclear weapons early in Ukraine war
item.description: CIA Director Williams Burns said the risk of escalation should not be taken lightly, but the U.S. should also not be intimidated by Russia.

item.title: Boeing and union reach a labor deal, potentially averting a strike
item.description: The four-year deal between Boeing and its Seattle-area workers' union comes with 25% raises over the four years of the contract.

item.title: World swelters through its hottest summer on record for the second year running
item.description: The summer of 2024 was the hottest in history, according to the European Union's climate monitor.

item.title: China's wealthy are increasingly looking overseas for business investment opportunities
item.description: China's wealthy want to pursue business opportunities abroad, rather than just investment returns, according to asset managers and consultants.

item.title: Coinbase has worst week of the year as crypto stocks plummet
item.description: Concerns about the U.S. economy led to a broad market slide this week, with crypto-related assets seeing some of the steepest drops.

item.title: AI craze is distorting VC market, as tech giants like Microsoft and Amazon pour in billions of dollars
item.description: With the biggest companies in the world throwing billions of dollars at generative AI startups, traditional VCs are struggling to find their place in the boom.

item.title: Trump is no threat to U.S. democracy, according to historian Niall Ferguson
item.description: "The system contained Trump's impulses in 2020, 2021, successfully, and I think it would contain them again," Ferguson said.

item.title: August payrolls grew by a less-than-expected 142,000, but unemployment rate ticked down to 4.2%
item.description: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to expand by 161,000 in August while the unemployment rate fell to 4.2%.

item.title: Eighty-eight corporate leaders endorse Harris in new letter, including CEOs of Yelp, Box
item.description: The letter is meant as a political show of force for Kamala Harris in a tight race with Donald Trump. The first presidential debate is less than a week away.

item.title: Once the envy of the world, Germany's car brands now weigh heavily on its struggling economy
item.description: Germany’s car industry was once recognized around the world for its high-quality, innovative internal combustion engine cars. But where is the sector now?
